newsitem.title: FINLAND: MERITA SEES LOWER FINNISH 97 FOREST PROFITS - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: MERITA SEES LOWER FINNISH 97 FOREST PROFITS - PAPER.

text.p: Finnish brokerage Merita Securities expects combined net profit of listed forestry companies to be 3.90 billion markka in 1996 and 3.75 billion in 1997, down from 9.32 billion in 1995, daily Kauppalehti reported on Monday.

"Some price increases have gone through in fine papers, but next year, more capacity will come on stream ... Unless pulp prices start to rise by then, the weakness may spread to fine paper and then to other products," Kauppalehti quoted Merita chief analyst Elina Timonen as saying.

Merita expects combined net profit of all Helsinki bourse listed companies, excluding Merita Bank , to be 15.59 billion markka in 1996 and 19.58 billion in 1997, down from 22.92 billion in 1995, the paper said.
